intro: Pisonia purpusii, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bright red or orange flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has palm-like leaves and produces fluffy, white seed pods that release tiny seeds with silky hairs. It thrives in coastal areas and is often found in dry, sunny habitats. Pisonia purpusii plays an important ecological role in supporting local wildlife and is a symbol of Hawaii's unique flora.
